snippet: On Friday, the Japanese bank said it was likely involved in a new insider trading case, months after the firm's chief executive, Kenichi Watanabe, resigned following similar allegations.
abstract: On Friday, the Japanese bank said it was likely involved in a new insider trading case, months after the firm's chief executive, Kenichi Watanabe, resigned following similar allegations.

headline.main: Nomura Faces Another Insider Trading Case
